name: Glenwys
subtitle: Shield of Empire
description: A female knight born as a commoner in the Empire. She is revered by countless commoners, having claimed her position as the Vice Captain of the Capital Guard Knights with nothing but her skills. She vowed to become the shield that protects imperial citizens, and there is no one more devoted to serving the Empire.
story: If you ask the citizens of the Empire to pick a knight that they love the most, Glenwys's name will be on the top of the list. She is a Vice Captain in Empire Capital Guard Knights, the highest post taken by a knight with a background as a commoner. With her fierce combat skills along with her modesty and strong sense of responsibility, being a knight is her calling of life. There's no doubt that Glenwys is the hope for all commoners of the Empire, considering that she earned her way to the position of Vice Captain and that she won the 3 fighting tournaments that the Emperor held himself. As a symbol of the belief that anyone with skills can achieve success in the Empire, she is receiving a lot of attention from many.
like: Training, smiles of Empire Citizens, lively atmosphere, apple pies.
dislike: Citizens suffering, social gatherings and parties of nobles.

inn.idle: It's a good inn, and everything here's nice and clean. The food looks amazing, too.

recruit.greet: Hello. How have you been doing?
talk: Oh, just a loaf of bread and some soup would be fine. I don't really enjoy eating gourmet dishes.
Ha ha, a knight needs to rest sometimes.
recruit.gift: A present... for me? U-um... Th-thank you for your kindness.

talk: Are you done for the day? How about we train together?
We consider capability more than background in the Empire. Ceaseless effort is the only way to success.
affinity.gift: I don't deserve a gift like this, but... thank you. I will work hard to return this favor.

relationship.greet: Oh, there you are. Would you like to get something to eat together?
talk: Sometimes... I feel I don't deserve the admiration that I see in the eyes of the children from the village.
I get along well with knights of noble birth. Some would even spar with me.
I am always grateful to His Majesty. It's because of His Majesty's grace that a commoner like me could become what I am today.

uw.story: A shield and a gunblade crafted with the cutting-edge mechanical engineering of the Empire. The gunblade is a prototype made by the Department of Mechanical Engineering of Magos Le'Flamme, and it is a deadly weapon designed to attack multiple enemies at close range. The shield was designed to parry and counterattack enemy strikes, and its ability to absorb and mitigate shock is unmatched. It was a gift awarded by the royal family of the Empire in recognition of Glenwys's achievements after joining the Knights.

ut.story: The Annual Imperial Colosseum Tournament was where all the courageous fighter could compete to prove their worth, regardless of their origins and social ranks, but the winner was always a well-equipped nobleman, knight, or soldier sponsored by noble families. Everyone knew it was no longer fair, but no one would dare say it out loud. However, Glenwys, a 16-year-old commoner girl who had no strings to pull, won the tournament 4 years ago and the noble purpose of the competition was regained. On the day of her victory, the Colosseum was filled with thundering applause of the audience who were longing to see haughty aristocrats lose what they thought belonged to them. Glenwys became a new idol of the Empire, and people were buying gifts for her. Glenwys, however, had to turn down all the gifts. Not only was the national attention too much for her, but she also knew that those with power would never take joy in seeing commoners rally around a hero like her. Nevertheless, she could not say no to a timid little girl that came holding a paperweight made of dandelions in her small hands, and it became the only present that she kept for herself.

ut.story: The last present from an anonymous supporter. Glenwys became the first tournament winner with a commoner's background, but what she needed to pay to defend her position in the following Imperial Colosseum Tournaments was far above an ordinary commoner's income. Most of her participation fee would come from the donations of citizens, but the time eventually came when the cost got too expensive for her to carry on competing. However, to her surprise, help came for her from an anonymous supporter every time she was desperate for it, enabling her to continue fighting. On the day that she became the winner of 3 consecutive tournaments, the 'Ballas Ruby,' a jewel of a knight, was delivered to her, which became the last gesture of support she ever got from the nameless helper. Since then, this ruby became her charm of victory that she always carries with her, grateful, but curious about who the supporter might be.

ut.story: A golden trophy awarded to Glenwys for winning 3 consecutive Imperial Colosseum Tournaments. It's the Emperor's gift to the true hero of the Colosseum. The third championship match was the last tournament match in which Glenwys fought in. Her last opponent was a mysterious man with a mask who defeated all his opponents throughout the tournament in less than a few seconds. Glenwys was nervous when she saw him fight in the semi-final match. As expected, the fight was one-sided. A man swung a pair of red swords at Glenwys like a red storm. She waited for an opportunity while blocking his fierce attacks. The man finally seemed to let his guard down, and Glenwys launched a powerful strike. But to her surprise, the man dodged it simply by taking a few steps back. However, the explosion caused by Glenwys's attack made the man's mask crack, revealing his handsome face. She then saw, through the breaking mask, that the man was smiling. Noticing that her attack didn't leave a scratch on him, Glenwys raised her shield up again, appalled, but the man suddenly threw the towel. Soon, the smoke around the two people cleared, and there was another mask on the man's face. Shocked and astonished, Glenwys could not understand what had happened until the Emperor handed her the trophy, until she saw the man standing behind the Emperor with the Royal Guard Captain, giving her a warm applause.
